meanings.definition: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.
meanings.sent1: The prices at the store were too high for me to afford.
meanings.sent2: I compared the prices of different brands before making a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog offered to pay the prices with bones instead of money.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness came at a price, but it was worth every penny.
meanings.sent5: The prices shouted at me from the bright neon sign, impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: To determine the value of something in terms of money.
meanings.sent1: She prices her handmade crafts based on the time and materials used.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent will price the house after assessing its condition.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to price the value of the disappearing act, but it was priceless.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty cannot be priced, it is truly invaluable.
meanings.sent5: The antique vase was carefully priced by the expert appraiser.

meanings.definition: To set the value of something for sale.
meanings.sent1: The artist priced her paintings competitively to attract buyers.
meanings.sent2: The bakery owner decided to price the cupcakes at a reasonable rate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to price the toy soldiers at outrageous amounts.
meanings.sent4: She priced her time and expertise fairly, never overcharging her clients.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler carefully priced the diamond ring, taking into account its clarity and carat weight.
